verses.verse: To the chief Musician,<WH5329> Al-taschith,<WH516> Michtam<WH4387> of David;<WH1732> when Saul<WH7586> sent,<WH7971> and they watched<WH8104> <WH853> the house<WH1004> to kill<WH4191> him. Deliver<WH5337> me from mine enemies,<WH4480> <WH341> O my God:<WH430> defend<WH7682> me from them that rise up against<WH4480> <WH6965> me.
Deliver <WH5337> me from the workers<WH4480> <WH6466> of iniquity,<WH205> and save<WH3467> me from bloody<WH1818> men.<WH4480> <WH376>

For, <WH3588> lo,<WH2009> they lie in wait<WH693> for my soul:<WH5315> the mighty<WH5794> are gathered<WH1481> against<WH5921> me; not<WH3808> for my transgression,<WH6588> nor<WH3808> for my sin,<WH2403> O LORD.<WH3068>
They run<WH7323> and prepare themselves<WH3559> without<WH1097> my fault:<WH5771> awake<WH5782> to help<WH7125> me, and behold.<WH7200>

Thou <WH859> therefore, O LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of hosts,<WH6635> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> awake<WH6974> to visit<WH6485> all<WH3605> the heathen:<WH1471> be not<WH408> merciful<WH2603> to any<WH3605> wicked<WH205> transgressors.<WH898> Selah.<WH5542>
They return<WH7725> at evening:<WH6153> they make a noise<WH1993> like a dog,<WH3611> and go round about<WH5437> the city.<WH5892>
Behold, <WH2009> they belch out<WH5042> with their mouth:<WH6310> swords<WH2719> are in their lips:<WH8193> for<WH3588> who,<WH4310> say they, doth hear?<WH8085>
But thou,<WH859> O LORD,<WH3068> shalt laugh<WH7832> at them; thou shalt have all<WH3605> the heathen<WH1471> in derision.<WH3932>
Because of his strength<WH5797> will I wait<WH8104> upon<WH413> thee: for<WH3588> God<WH430> is my defense.<WH4869>
The God<WH430> of my mercy<WH2617> shall prevent<WH6923> me: God<WH430> shall let me see<WH7200> my desire upon mine enemies.<WH8324>
Slay <WH2026> them not,<WH408> lest<WH6435> my people<WH5971> forget:<WH7911> scatter<WH5128> them by thy power;<WH2428> and bring them down,<WH3381> O Lord<WH136> our shield.<WH4043>

For the sin<WH2403> of their mouth<WH6310> and the words<WH1697> of their lips<WH8193> let them even be taken<WH3920> in their pride:<WH1347> and for cursing<WH4480> <WH423> and lying<WH4480> <WH3585> which they speak.<WH5608>

Consume <WH3615> them in wrath,<WH2534> consume<WH3615> them, that they may not<WH369> be: and let them know<WH3045> that<WH3588> God<WH430> ruleth<WH4910> in Jacob<WH3290> unto the ends<WH657> of the earth.<WH776> Selah.<WH5542>
And at evening<WH6153> let them return;<WH7725> and let them make a noise<WH1993> like a dog,<WH3611> and go round about<WH5437> the city.<WH5892>
Let them<WH1992> wander up and down<WH5128> for meat,<WH398> and grudge<WH3885> if<WH518> they be not<WH3808> satisfied.<WH7646>

But I<WH589> will sing<WH7891> of thy power;<WH5797> yea, I will sing aloud<WH7442> of thy mercy<WH2617> in the morning:<WH1242> for<WH3588> thou hast been<WH1961> my defense<WH4869> and refuge<WH4498> in the day<WH3117> of my trouble.<WH6862>
Unto <WH413> thee, O my strength,<WH5797> will I sing:<WH2167> for<WH3588> God<WH430> is my defense,<WH4869> and the God<WH430> of my mercy.<WH2617>
